frame.name: Artifact_subpart
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Component</fen> has a distinct <fen>Function</fen> in the operation of a complex <fen>Artifact</fen>, which is not regarded as complete unless it is assembled from a number of different <fen>Component</fen>s. Each <fen>Component</fen> may also be described by their <fen>Creator</fen>, <fen>Time_of_creation</fen>, or <fen>Material</fen>.
<ex>Most of the cost comes from the price of <fex name="Artifact">engine</fex> <fex name="Component"><t>parts</t></fex>.</ex> <ex>We'll need to find a <fex name="Material">metal</fex> <fex name="Component"><t>part</t></fex><fex name="Time_of_creation">from 1982</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Component
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity that is a part of an <fen>Artifact</fen> and serves a distinct <fen>Function</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Artifact
FE.definition: <def-root>A deliberately made entity which fulfilling a purpose, whose complete form is composed of more than one <fen>Component</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Function
FE.definition: <def-root>The role or purpose of the <fen>Component</fen> as it pertains to the <fen>Artifact</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition: <def-root>The type of matter that the <fen>Component</fen> comprises.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: part.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an object that serves a distinct function in a complex artifact, especially of machines.
